ParentCompanyName: Goodwill Industries of Southeastern Wisconsin, Inc

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary
I. Accidental Release Prevention and Response Policies
Goodwill Manufacturing, Inc. Facility is making a commitment to worker and public safety, and to the environment.  This commitment is demonstrated by the resources invested in accident prevention, such as training personnel and considering safety in the design, installation, operation and maintenance of the facility.  Goodwill Manufacturing's policy is to implement reasonable measures to prevent foreseeable releases of regulated substances. 

II. Description of the Stationary Source and Regulated Substances
The Goodwill Manufacturing Facility, located in Sturtevant, Racine County, Wisconsin, operates a facility with a caged aerosol can storage area. The aerosol cans contain a single regulated flammable mixture, which contains butane and propane. The facility does not have any regulated toxic substances.  The Goodwill Manufacturing Facility is a Program 1 Level facility.

III. General Accident Release Prevention Program & Chemical -Specific Prevention Steps
The Goodwill Manufacturing Facility will continue to address the RMP release prevention program with the following elements. 
-  Safety Equipment: The Goodwill Manufacturing Facility has safety features in the aerosol can storage area to quickly detect a release, and reduce the consequences of (mitigate) a release.  The Facility maintains the following safety equipment: spill kits, fire extinguishers, safety shower, eye wash, fire alarms, fire water sprinklers, caged aerosol storage area with smoke triggered overhead door closure, and security cameras.
- Training: The Goodwill Manufacturing Facility has an effective emergency response training program for all employees, which includes chemical spill response measures.  Additionally, the facility conducts fire, medical and chemical spill drills twice a year.  The facility also has a comprehensive forklift operator training program since the forklift operators are the majority of personnel who

work in the caged aerosol storage area.   
-Incident Investigation:  The Goodwill Manufacturing Facility has an Incident Investigation procedure in place, in the event it will need to be used.  

IV. Five-year Accident History
The Goodwill Manufacturing Facility has an excellent record of accident prevention over the past five years. There have been no accidental releases of regulated substances in the past five years.

V. Emergency Response Information
The Goodwill Manufacturing Facility has developed and implemented a written emergency action plan to protect worker and public safety as well as the environment. The plan consists of elements such as: communication procedures for responding to a chemical spill; response to a fire, severe weather response, security emergency, or medical emergency.  The emergency response program is updated when necessary based on factors such as modification made to the plant process or change in the communication procedures.

VI. Planned Changes to Improve Safety
The Goodwill Manufacturing Facility will continue to improve employee training resources and conduct safety audits and incident investigations as applicable to continuously improve the worker and public safety.
